Class HtmlPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • HtmlPrinter

  • public class HtmlPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
    A client that manages printing to a TextWindow.
    Since:
    October 21st, 2016
    Author:
    Ofek Gila, Saagar Jha

      • print

        public void print(java.lang.String str)
        Prints a string with current formatting (Color and Font). This method is identical to printParagraph
        Parameters:
        str - the String to print

      • println

        private void println(java.lang.String str,
                     java.awt.Font font,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Prints a string with a specific Font and Color, breaking after.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to print
        font - the Font to use
        color - the Color to use

      • println

        public void println()
        Breaks with a height equal to to the height of the last component / fragment. Used to move onto the next line.

      • breakComponent

        private void breakComponent(HtmlComponent htmlComponent)
        Inserts a break with a line height equal to the height of the last component.
        Parameters:
        htmlComponent - the HtmlComponent whose height to use

      • printParagraph

        public void printParagraph(java.lang.String str)
        Print method to print normal text, formatted with setColor and setFont. This method is the same as print(String str)
        Parameters:
        str - the String to print

        Prints text in bold.
        Parameters:

      • breakIfNecessary

        private void breakIfNecessary()
        Breaks if the previous component is not a break. This breaks using the same size as the previous component (not the default break size).

      • breakIfDifferentSize

        private void breakIfDifferentSize(java.awt.Font font)
        Breaks if the Font used is a different size than the previous font used.
        Parameters:
        font - the Font to use

      • printBreak

        public void printBreak()
        Prints a break, using the default break size. If already in the middle of a line, breaks out of that line first, and then prints a break. Made to mimic the html br tag.

      • printHorizontalRule

        public void printHorizontalRule()
        Prints a horizontal rule. If already in the middle of a line, breaks out of that line first, and then prints the rule. Made to mimic the html hr tag.

      • getHeadingFont

        private java.awt.Font getHeadingFont(int fontSize)
        Generates a heading font with the appropriate fontSize.
        Parameters:
        fontSize - the font size of the heading
        Returns:
        the appropriate heading Font

      • setFont

        public void setFont(java.awt.Font font)
        Sets the font to be used.
        Parameters:
        font - the Font to set

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color to be used.
        Parameters:
        color - the Color to set

      • setPreventDrawing

        public void setPreventDrawing(boolean preventDrawing)
        Sets whether the TextWindow should repaint after printing. Setting this to false improves performance, but a call to drawHtmlComponents is necessary after printing is done.
        Parameters:
        preventDrawing - false if to allow drawing, true to prevent

      • preventDrawing

        public void preventDrawing()
        Prevents drawing by default after print statements. Must call drawHtmlComponents manually when finished printing.
